summary.p: 322 fol.; Writing surface: paper; Shelfmark: E. H. 78; Qurʾānic Text: complete muṣḥaf; 15 lines per page; Dimensions: 95 x 145mm; Script style: nasḫ; Date of production: 1267 CE.

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 31: "93 E. H. 78. Mushaf. Aharlı krem rengi vassaleli kâğıt. 145mm boy ve 95mm eninde 322 yaprak. Sahifede harekeli ince nesihle 45mm uzunl.[uğunda] 15 satır. Yāḳūt al-Mustaʿṣimī eli ile 665 (1267) yılı Recebinde istinsah edilmiştir. Y. 1b, 2a da müzehhep levha içinde Fatiḥa ve Eliflam yazılı. Bütün sahife kenarları halkârî, sure başları, secde, hızıp v.s. gülleri müzehhep, durak ve cetveller yaldızlı. Miklcpli sıvama yaldız kabartmalı vişneçürüğü deri cilt."

This can be translated as follows: "93 E. H. 78. Muṣḥaf. Cream-colored sized paper with the technique of vaṣṣālī. 322 leaves of 145 mm height and 95 mm width. The text area written in naskh with diacritics, [contains] 15 lines measuring 45 mm height. Copied by Yāḳūt al-Mustaʿṣimī during the month of Rajab in the year 665 (1267). There is illuminated plate written al-Fātiḥa and Alif-Lām on (Leaf) L. 1b and 2a. All edges are gilded (halkâri), sūra beginnings, sajda, ḥizb, and sajda roses are illuminated. Verse separators and and the rule-borders are gilded. Cherrybrown leather binding with embossed gilding (sıvama yaldız), and flap (miklep).”
